metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14403 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in LibVNCServer before 0.9.13.libvncserver/hextile.c allows out-of-bounds access via encodings.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14403` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.13+dfsg-1
libvncserver1 - 0.9.13+dfsg-1
No subscription required

vino - 3.22.0-6ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.13+dfsg-1').
vino package in esm-apps/jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.22.0-6ubuntu2').
x11vnc package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
veyon package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
